title: Yayoi Kusama correspondance, contract and other materials

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Yayoi Kusama correspondance, contract and other materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All memos, contracts, correspondence and other records related to the development of "A Message of Love, Directly from My Heart unto the Universe (2022)" by Yayoi Kusama for the new Grand Central Madison terminal, including any draft or model versions of the art.

The artwork is described here: https://new.mta.info/agency/arts-design/collection/a-message-of-love-directly-from-my-heart-unto-the-universe

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Didion-Dunne collection acqusition contract and cost

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Didion-Dunne collection acqusition contract and cost
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The full contract and cost of acquiring the personal letters of Joan Didion and John Gregory Dunne. According to the following report in the New York Times, the NYPL acquired the collection in recent weeks: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/26/arts/joan-didion-archive-nypl.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh
